page.title: 06CARBOST NEW PRIMARY SCHOOL.
page.content: To meet the requirements of the Education Act(Scotland)-1981,a Consultative Paper was prepared in 1984,concerning re-organisation of Primary Education in the areas served by Carbost and Portnalong Schools. As a result, a new Primary School will be built in the centre of Carbost,to take in the pupils from both schools.Neither existing building is considered suitable accomodation,both lacking many modern facilities. Planned for 1987,the new school will have a kitchen,gym/dining hall,staff facilities,medical room and G.P.room as well as 2 classrooms and toilets. The community is delighted by the prospect and look forward to a 'real' community school,since the present one is already a focal point for it.
